Utilities

Margin and padding

Padding & margin sizes are set in the spacing.scss file, to add one, you have to add to the map in variables.scss which will autogenerate the classes.

Class values

  • .m — margin
  • .p — padding

Location values

  • t = top
  • b = bottom
  • l = left
  • r = right

Breakpoints

The classes are mobile by default

  • med = > mobile breakpoint (768px)

Size values

Size values are the number presented / 100 as rem, so 100 = 1rem, 050 = 0.5rem

  • 0 = 0rem
  • 0125 = 0.125rem
  • 025 = 0.25rem
  • 0375 = 0.375rem
  • 050 = 0.5rem
  • 075 = 0.75rem
  • 100 = 1rem
  • 125 = 1.25rem
  • 150 = 1.5rem
  • 200 = 2rem
  • 250 = 2.5rem
  • 300 = 3rem
  • 350 = 3.5rem
  • 400 = 4rem
  • 450 = 4.5rem
  • 500 = 5rem

Examples

  • .p-t-050
  • .m-b-200-med
  • .p-250

This has .p-0

This has .p-050

This has .p-100

This has .p-200

This has .p-250

This has .p-300-med .p-100

Display

Display types

.d-inline = display: inline

.d-inline-block = display: inline-block

.d-block = display: block

.d-none = display: none

.d-none-sml = display: none; when width less than mobile xxsmall (480px)

.d-none-med = display: none; when width greater than mobile (768px)

.d-none-lrg = display: none; when width is greater than widescreen (1280px)

Box shadow

.box-shadow

Breakpoints

  • Mobile breakpoint $mobile-breakpoint: 480px
  • Laptop / Tablet breakpoint $mobile-breakpoint: 769px
  • Desktop breakpoint $tablet-breakpoint: 1280px

Box Shadows

.box-shadow

Rounded corners

Rounded corners small .round-sm

Rounded corners medium .round-med

Flex classes

There are multiple built in flex classes

  • .flex = display: flex;
  • .flex-inline = display: inline-flex;
  • .flex-row = flex-direction: row;
  • .flex-column = flex-direction: column;
  • .flex-wrap = flex-wrap: wrap;
  • .flex-nowrap = flex-wrap: nowrap;
  • There are classes for gap aswell
    • .gap-size = gap: size;
    • .gap-size-row = row-gap: size;
    • .gap-size-column = column-gap: size;
  • Size is to be replaced by an actual size
    • .gap-0 = 0
    • .gap-200 = 2rem
    • .gap-050 = 0.5rem
    • .gap-100 = 1rem
    • .gap-100 = 2.5rem
    • .gap-300 = 3rem
  • There are classes for justify-content
    • .space-around
    • .space-evenly
    • .space-between
    • .space-center
  • There are classes for align-items
    • .align-start
    • .align-center
    • .align-end

Button Icons

All icons have .flex .space-between .align-center on the p element

You can make all icons appear before by adding -before to the end of it, e.g. .plus-before

All the same additional classes work the same, so a small version would be .plus-before .plus-s

Grid Styles — CSS Grid

Understanding the naming and classes convention

The grid system is the core layout to be used with components, it uses the CSS display of grid to ensure items in components are in line. It is used with the class .grid-12

By default the grid has a gap of 1rem, you can remove this gap by adding the class .nogap to the parent.

grid sizing is done with .col-x classes, where x is equal to a number from 1-12. The number correlates to the span value, so .col-3 is equal to span 3.

.col-x is the default sizing (mobile), you can change the size of the element at different breakpoints by adding another class with a sizing on. .col-x-med is used for laptop and .col-x-lrg is used for desktop / widescreen.

All elements need a default .col-x but not all elements need a .col-x-med etc. An example of an element with all breakpoints is (class="col-12 col-6-med col-3-lrg")

.grid-12

.col-6 .col-4-med .col-3-lrg

.col-6 .col-4-med .col-3-lrg

.col-6 .col-4-med .col-3-lrg

.col-6 .col-4-med .col-3-lrg

.col-4

.col-4

.col-4

.col-6

.col-6

.col-4

.col-8

.col-6

.col-3

.col-3

.col-12

Column Styles — CSS Flex

Understanding the naming and classes convention

The column system is the secondary layout option to be used with components, it uses the CSS display of flex and aligns with .grid-12. It is used with the class .columns

By default the columns have gaps of 1rem, you can remove this gap by adding the class .nogap to the parent.

grid sizing is done with .col-x classes, where x is equal to a number from 1-12. The number correlates to the span value, so .col-3 is equal to span 3.

.col-x is the default sizing (mobile), you can change the size of the element at different breakpoints by adding another class with a sizing on. .col-x-med is used for laptop and .col-x-lrg is used for desktop / widescreen.

All elements need a default .col-x but not all elements need a .col-x-med etc. An example of an element with all breakpoints is (class="col-12 col-6-med col-3-lrg")

The column system uses flex-grow to force 100% on elements, this means that if you have .col-3 and nothing else to fill gap, it will expand that element to 100% width

.columns .nogap

.col-6 .col-4-med .col-3-lrg

.col-6 .col-4-med .col-3-lrg

.col-6 .col-4-med .col-3-lrg

.col-6 .col-4-med .col-3-lrg

.col-4

.col-4

.col-4

.col-6

.col-6

.col-4

.col-8

.col-6

.col-3

.col-3

.col-12

Component structure

This is the preferred component layout

Structure

  • section class="wrapper"
  • div class="container" This sets the column width using max-width. For a full width component leave this class out
  • h2 class="header"
  • Content / Grid / columns etc here

Overflow component

.col-4-overflow

.col-4-overflow

.col-4-overflow

.col-4-overflow

Overflow components need to follow the structure of this component to work.

Overflow components must used flex .columns, they also need .flex-nowrap, .overflow_x-auto, .overflow-scroll & .scrollwheel-scrollto work.

.overflow-scroll is required for click drag, it has no styling, it is purely used as an element finder for JS.

.scrollwheel-scroll is required for horizontal scrolling with mouse wheel event, it has no styling, it is purely used as an element finder for JS.

optional classes are .scrollbar-hide & .grab

Hover states

.image-hover

.image-hover requires a div with the class .image-hover applied AND a background colour e.g. bg-ocean-3 applied. The img sits inside the wrapper div.

.hover

This is the default hover state class for components, used primarily with titles e.g. article title. Because of the nature of CCTs there is a mixin that contains the styling for the hover (@include defaultHover). This mixin is to be used when you need to alter the selector used with the hover, e.g. Wrapped an article with a link element, want the title to hover when any part of the article is hovered.

.nodec-hover override text-decoration on hover
